DataElement.preferredName: Hematopoietic Cell Graft Infusion Procedure Adverse Event Adverse Event Type
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A description of the hematopoietic cell graft infusion adverse event.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Hematopoietic Cell Graft Infusion Procedure Adverse Event
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Primitive blood cells derived from embryonic mesenchyme capable of differentiating into any of the blood cell line progenitor cells (erythroblasts, young granulocytic series cells, megakaryocytes, etc._Healthy skin, bone, or other tissue taken from one part of the body and used to replace diseased or injured tissue removed from another part of the body._A method of putting fluids, including drugs, into the bloodstream. Also called intravenous infusion._Any unfavorable or unintended symptom, sign, or disease, including an abnormal laboratory finding, temporally associated with the use of a medical treatment or procedure that may or may not be considered related to the medical treatment or procedure. Such events can be intervention related, dose related, route related, patient related, or caused by an interaction with another drug(s) or procedure(s).

ObjectClass.preferredName: Hematopoietic Stem Cell Graft Infusion Procedure
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Primitive blood cells derived from embryonic mesenchyme capable of differentiating into any of the blood cell line progenitor cells (erythroblasts, young granulocytic series cells, megakaryocytes, etc.):Healthy skin, bone, or other tissue taken from one part of the body and used to replace diseased or injured tissue removed from another part of the body.:A method of putting fluids, including drugs, into the bloodstream. Also called intravenous infusion.

Concepts.definition: Primitive blood cells derived from embryonic mesenchyme capable of differentiating into any of the blood cell line progenitor cells (erythroblasts, young granulocytic series cells, megakaryocytes, etc.)
Tissue or organ transplanted from a donor to a recipient.
Any form of treatment that is introduced into the body via a blood vessel, a muscle, or the spinal cord.

Property.preferredDefinition: Any unfavorable and unintended sign (including an abnormal laboratory finding), symptom, syndrome, or disease, temporally associated with the use of a medical product or procedure, regardless of whether or not it is considered related to the product or procedure (attribution of unrelated, unlikely, possible, probable, or definite). The concept refers to events that could be medical product related, dose related, route related, patient related, caused by an interaction with another therapy or procedure, or caused by opioid initiation or dose escalation. The term also is referred to as an adverse experience. The old term Side Effect is retired and should not be used.

Concepts.definition: Any unfavorable or unintended disease, sign, or symptom (including an abnormal laboratory finding) that is temporally associated with the use of a medical treatment or procedure, and that may or may not be considered related to the medical treatment or procedure. Such events can be related to the intervention, dose, route of administration, patient, or caused by an interaction with another drug(s) or procedure(s).

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results of evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Any unfavorable or unintended symptom, sign, or disease including an abnormal laboratory finding temporally associated with the use of a medical treatment or procedure that may or may not be considered related to the medical treatment or procedure.  Such events can be intervention related, dose related, route related, patient related, or caused by an interaction with another drug(s) or procedure(s)._Type; a subdivision of a particular kind of thing.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Whole; including all components without exception; being one unit or constituting the full amount or extent or duration; complete.: The presence of free hemoglobin in the urine.

Concepts.definition: Including all components without exception; constituting the full amount or extent or duration; complete.
A laboratory test result which indicates free hemoglobin in the urine.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Vomiting; the reflex act of ejecting the contents of the stomach through the mouth.

Concepts.definition: Forceful ejection of the contents of the stomach through the mouth.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Tachycardia; an abnormally rapid heartbeat, usually applied to a heart rate above 100 per minute.

Concepts.definition: An abnormally rapid heart rate. Thresholds for different age, gender, and patient populations exist.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An uncomfortable sensation of difficulty breathing. It may present as an acute or chronic sign of an underlying respiratory or heart disorder.

Concepts.definition: An uncomfortable sensation of difficulty breathing. It may present as an acute or chronic sign of an underlying respiratory or heart disorder.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Nausea is the sensation of unease and discomfort from the stomach, with the sufferer feeling that he is about to vomit. (from Wikipedia)

Concepts.definition: Upper abdominal discomfort associated with an urge to vomit.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Abnormally low blood pressure seen in shock but not necessarily indicative of it. (Dorland, 28th ed)

Concepts.definition: Blood pressure that is abnormally low.
Blood pressure that is abnormally high.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A vascular reaction of the skin characterized by erythema and wheal formation due to localized increase of vascular permeability. The causative mechanism may be allergy, infection, or stress.

Concepts.definition: A transient, itchy skin eruption characterized by wheals with pale interiors and red margins.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Pain in various parts of the head, not confined to the area of distribution of any nerve.

Concepts.definition: Pain in various parts of the head, not confined to the area of distribution of any nerve.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An abnormally slow heartbeat; as applied in adult medicine, it is generally defined as a heart rate of under 60 beats per minute.

Concepts.definition: An abnormally slow heart rate. Thresholds for different age, gender, and patient populations exist.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Used to indicate position, location, or state (American Heritage Dictionary): A method of putting fluids, including drugs, into the bloodstream. Also called intravenous infusion.: the continuum of experience in which events pass from the future through the present to the past.: Chills; a sensation of cold that often marks the start of an infection and the development of a fever.

Concepts.definition: Used to indicate position, location, or state.
Any form of treatment that is introduced into the body via a blood vessel, a muscle, or the spinal cord.
The continuum of experience in which events pass from the future through the present to the past.
Shivering or moderate tremors of the body often accompanied by a cold sensation.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not otherwise specified.: Expected; considered likely or probable.: Any unfavorable and unintended sign (including an abnormal laboratory finding), symptom, syndrome, or disease, temporally associated with the use of a medical product or procedure, regardless of whether or not it is considered related to the product or procedure (attribution of unrelated, unlikely, possible, probable, or definite). The concept refers to events that could be medical product related, dose related, route related, patient related, caused by an interaction with another therapy or procedure, or caused by opioid initiation or dose escalation. The term also is referred to as an adverse experience. The old term Side Effect is retired and should not be used.

Concepts.definition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.
Considered likely or probable; anticipated.

Any unfavorable or unintended disease, sign, or symptom (including an abnormal laboratory finding) that is temporally associated with the use of a medical treatment or procedure, and that may or may not be considered related to the medical treatment or procedure. Such events can be related to the intervention, dose, route of administration, patient, or caused by an interaction with another drug(s) or procedure(s).

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not otherwise specified.: Any adverse event associated with a medical product or procedure that has not been previously observed, whether or not the event was anticipated because of the pharmacologic properties of the study agent or the nature of the medical procedure. This includes events that are more serious than expected or occur more frequently than expected, particularly, any adverse experience, the nature, severity or frequency of which is not consistent with the product label, or with the current investigator brochure for investigational agent; or with the risk information described in the investigational plan or protocol or consent form.

Concepts.definition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

Any adverse event associated with a medical product or procedure that has not been previously observed, whether or not the event was anticipated because of the pharmacologic properties of the study agent or the nature of the medical procedure. This includes events that are more serious than expected or occur more frequently than expected, particularly, any adverse experience, the nature, severity or frequency of which is not consistent with the product label, or with the current investigator brochure for investigational agent; or with the risk information described in the investigational plan or protocol or consent form.
Pain in the chest.
Mild

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Severe or prolonged, not responsive to narcotics

Concepts.definition: Severe or prolonged, not responsive to narcotics

PermissibleValues.value: Fever <= 103° F within 24 hours of infusion

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Less Than or Equal To Integer::103 Degree Fahrenheit Fever
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A statement about the relative size or order of two objects specifying that either both objects are the same in quantity or measure or value or status or that the object of interest is smaller than the other object in one of these ways.: A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.::103: A unit of temperature of the temperature scale designed so that the freezing point of water is 32 degrees and the boiling point is 212 degrees, placing the boiling and melting points of water 180 degrees apart. One degree Fahrenheit is 5/9ths of a kelvin (or of a degree Celsius), and minus 40 degrees Fahrenheit is equal to minus 40 degrees Celsius.: Elevation of body temperature above normal due to inflammatory or immune responses.

Concepts.definition: A statement about the relative size or order of two objects specifying that either both objects are the same in quantity or measure or value or status or that the object of interest is smaller than the other object in one of these ways.
A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.

A unit of temperature of the temperature scale designed so that the freezing point of water is 32 degrees and the boiling point is 212 degrees, placing the boiling and melting points of water 180 degrees apart. One degree Fahrenheit is 5/9ths of a kelvin (or of a degree Celsius), and minus 40 degrees Fahrenheit is equal to minus 40 degrees Celsius.
Elevation of body temperature above normal due to inflammatory or immune responses.

PermissibleValues.value: Fever > 103° F within 24 hours of infusion

One degree Fahrenheit is 5/9ths of a kelvin (or of a degree Celsius), and minus 40 degrees Fahrenheit is equal to minus 40 degrees Celsius.: Elevation of body temperature above normal due to inflammatory or immune responses.

Concepts.definition: A statement about the relative size or order of two objects specifying that an object of interest exceeds another object in quantity or measure or value or status.
A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.

A unit of temperature of the temperature scale designed so that the freezing point of water is 32 degrees and the boiling point is 212 degrees, placing the boiling and melting points of water 180 degrees apart. One degree Fahrenheit is 5/9ths of a kelvin (or of a degree Celsius), and minus 40 degrees Fahrenheit is equal to minus 40 degrees Celsius.
Elevation of body temperature above normal due to inflammatory or immune responses.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Required; necessary, not optional.: use this term only for elemental or gaseous oxygen (02); for other compounds see OXYGEN COMPOUND.: reduction of oxygen supply to tissue below physiological level.

Concepts.definition: Something that is a necessary condition; something that is obligatory.
An element with atomic symbol O, atomic number 8, and atomic weight 16.
A decrease in the amount of oxygen in the body. Symptoms range from mild (impaired judgment, memory loss, impaired motor coordination) to severe (seizures and coma).

ReferenceDocuments.description: What were the hematopoietic cell graft adverse events?

ReferenceDocuments.name: BRIDG mapping path for CDE:2739534
ReferenceDocuments.description: AdverseEvent.value(ANY=>CD).code WHERE  AdverseEvent > PerformedObservation [monitoring for AEs] > DefinedObservation.nameCode = "Post-Hematopoietic Stem Cell Transplantation Monitoring" AND AdverseEvent.occurenceDateRange(IVL<TS.DATETIME).low IS BETWEEN PerformedObservation.dateRange(IVL<TS.DATETIME).low AND (PerformedObservation.dateRange(IVL<TS.DATETIME).low + 48 HOURS) AND AdverseEvent > CausalAssessment > EvaluatedActivityRelationship > PerformedSubstanceAdministration [infusion] AND EvaluatedActivityRelationship.probabilityCode = "likely" OR "definite"
